prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert L. Whitehead. Speech, 1 February 1956. Accession 40053. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Robert Lovingston Whitehead (1897-1960), was born in Nelson County, Virginia, to Stuart Baldwin and Susan Massie Whitehead. He married Sallie Carter (1904-) on 16 June 1923 in Roseland, Virginia. He was elected to the Virginia House of Delegates for Nelson County in 1941, and served until his death in 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Speech, 1 February 1956, by Robert L. Whitehead, delegate from Nelson County, Virginia, made before the Virginia House of Delegates, in regards to House Joint Resolution No. 30, state interposition.
